material.mattext:
Quiz 5 - Robot arm kinematics

This quiz covers Chapter 5 of the notes.

 Instructions

  • This quiz consists of 10 questions, covering content from the previous week.
  • You are allowed to submit the quiz an unlimited number of times with no time limit, and on each submission you can review each incorrect question attempt after the fact.
  • When reattempting the quiz, only the previously incorrect question(s) from the last attempted quiz will be available to attempt. The correct question(s) from the last attempted quiz will automatically be added to your score.
In general, the number of degrees of freedom of a robot, \(N\), is determined by
The generalised requirement for a robot to reach every point in the task space is given by
The configuration space is equivalent to the task space (\(\mathcal{C}=\mathcal{T}\)) when
the robot is not constrained to operate SE(2).

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=l_2=1\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,0\},$$

determine the orientation of the end-effector.

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=l_2=1\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,0\},$$

determine the translation of the end-effector with respect to the world frame.

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=l_2=1\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,0\},$$

determine the transformation matrix \({^W{\bf T}_B}\).

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=1\) and \(l_2=2\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,\frac{\pi}{2}\},$$

determine the orientation of the end-effector.

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=1\) and \(l_2=2\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,\frac{\pi}{2}\},$$

determine the translation of the end-effector.

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=1\) and \(l_2=2\), and joint angles of 

$$\{\alpha,\beta\}=\{0,\frac{\pi}{2}\},$$

determine the transformation matrix \({^W{\bf T}_B}\).

Given a 2R robot arm operating in the \(\hat{\bf x}_W\)-\(\hat{\bf y}_W\) plane, with link lengths of \(l_1=1\) and \(l_2=2\), determine the required joint angles when the desired world-frame \(x\)-axis position and orientations are \(t_x^*=1\) and \(\psi^*=\frac{\pi}{4}\), respectively.
